posts.title: Quirky Family Adventures for Fans of The Addams Family
posts.text: If you enjoy the antics of this macabre and eccentric family, you may enjoy these stories, aimed at middle grade readers, of other quirky family adventures.

posts.title: Spooky Middle Grade Reads To Usher in Fall
posts.text: As you enjoy your apple or pumpkin pie and a cup of warm cider or cocoa, relax and enjoy these eerie tales that will put you in the mood for the season.

posts.title: Recent Adventure & Fantasy Reads to Enthrall Middle Grade Readers
posts.text: Have a seat, open the pages, and see what adventures await and what magical places you'll travel to.

posts.title: Fascinating Books for Kids Interested in Learning About Birds
posts.text: Birds are all around us and these nonfiction titles below are a great start for young readers who would like to learn more about them.

posts.title: Eco Fiction for Kids and Teens
posts.text: Eco-fiction are books about the environment and humans' relationship with it. In these works the Earth is not a secondary character, but a main character and influence in the human world.

posts.title: Heroines in Fairytales, Folklore, Fables and Legends for Young Readers
posts.text: These stories show women and girls using wits, strength and heart to overcome obstacles.

posts.title: Afrofuturism Fiction Suggestions for Kids, Teens & Adults
posts.text: Enjoy these stories that reimagine African diaspora culture through the lens of science fiction, fantasy and technology.

posts.title: Poetry for Children Written by Black Authors
posts.text: These books of poetry and stories told in verse speak to and celebrate Black children as well as tell some of the courageous and remarkable stories of their ancestors.

posts.title: Pearl Harbor & Japanese American Internment: Books for Children & Teens
posts.text: The books below, for children and teens, are a mixture of fiction and nonfiction books  to learn more about this event, its aftermath and the effect the internment and anti-Japanese sentiment had on individuals, families and communities.

posts.title: Children's Winter Poetry
posts.text: Winter is a time for sweaters, coats and hats.When snow falls the world is transformed. The collections of children's poetry listed below capture the spirit of the season.

posts.title: A Veterans Day Booklist for Children & Teens
posts.text: These titles—for young children, middle grades and teens—explore themes of loss, change and honor.

posts.title: Spooky, Bone-Chilling Tales for Middle Graders & Young Adults
posts.text: Turn off your lights, turn on your flashlights and be prepared to be spooked by these thrilling tales.

posts.title: Keeping Clean: Kids Books to Talk About Germs, Hygiene and Disease
posts.text: These titles can help you talk to kids about the importance of hygiene and how to achieve it as well as learn about previous pandemics and other illnesses and diseases to help put COVID-19 and its challenges into historic perspective.

posts.title: Storytime at Your House: Picture Books Available as E-Audiobooks
posts.text: Listen to these stories with your family and continue the storytime tradition.

posts.title: These Sci Fic & Fantasy Audiobooks Will Take Middle Grade Readers to New Worlds
posts.text: Have a seat and listen to these stories that will take you on an adventure.

posts.title: Fairytales, Fables and Folklore: E-Audiobooks to Enjoy
posts.text: Considering these stories started as oral tradition, it seems fitting to enjoy them as audiobooks.
